description:
Connect your devices into a secure WireGuardÂ®-based overlay network with SSO, MFA and granular access controls.

NetBird combines a configuration-free peer-to-peer private network and a centralized access control system in a single platform, making it easy to create secure private networks for your organization or home.
Connect. NetBird creates a WireGuard-based overlay network that automatically connects your machines over an encrypted tunnel, leaving behind the hassle of opening ports, complex firewall rules, VPN gateways, and so forth.
Secure. NetBird enables secure remote access by applying granular access policies while allowing you to manage them intuitively from a single place. Works universally on any infrastructure.
What's Changed
- [management] Add missing group usage checks for network resources and routes access control by @bcmmbaga in https://github.com/netbirdio/netbird/pull/3117
- [management] remove ids from policy creation api by @pascal-fischer in https://github.com/netbirdio/netbird/pull/2997
- [management] Fix networks net map generation with posture checks by @mlsmaycon in https://github.com/netbirdio/netbird/pull/3124
- [management] add selfhosted metrics for networks by @pascal-fischer in https://github.com/netbirdio/netbird/pull/3118
- [client] Ignore case when matching domains in handler chain by @lixmal in https://github.com/netbirdio/netbird/pull/3133
- [client] Allow inbound rosenpass port by @lixmal in https://github.com/netbirdio/netbird/pull/3109
- [management] Preserve jwt groups when accessing API with PAT by @bcmmbaga in https://github.com/netbirdio/netbird/pull/3128
- [management] remove sorting from network map generation by @pascal-fischer in https://github.com/netbirdio/netbird/pull/3126
- [management] Fix policy tests by @mlsmaycon in https://github.com/netbirdio/netbird/pull/3135
Full Changelog: https://github.com/netbirdio/netbird/compare/v0.35.1...v0.35.2
